title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #801: Dense Subgraphs in Graphs with Bounded Independence**

If G has n vertices and α(G) ≤ √n, then some set of ≤ √n vertices contains ≫ √n log n edges.

**Answer:** YES (Alon, 1996)

Graphs with small independence number must have locally dense regions.
mathContext: This captures a local-global phenomenon: a global constraint (bounded independence) implies local structure (dense subset).

title: Independence Number α(G)
content:
**α(G) = max{|S| : S is an independent set in G}**

An independent set has no edges between its vertices. The problem constrains α(G) ≤ √n.

title: Induced Edges
content:
**e(S) = number of edges in the subgraph induced by S**

Count edges with both endpoints in S. The problem asks for S with |S| ≤ √n but e(S) ≫ √n log n.

title: Erdos801Statement
content:
**Main Statement:**

∃ c > 0 such that for all n ≥ 2, for all G with n vertices:

If α(G) ≤ √n, then ∃ S with |S| ≤ √n and e(S) ≥ c · √n · log n

title: Alon's Theorem (1996)
content:
**Alon's Theorem:**

The statement Erdos801Statement is true.

Proved using probabilistic methods and concentration inequalities.

title: Logarithmic Factor is Necessary
content:
**The log n factor cannot be removed:**

One cannot replace √n log n with √n · ω(n) for any faster-growing function ω.

The bound is tight up to the constant.

title: Ramsey Connection
content:
**Connection to Ramsey Theory:**

Small independence ↔ complementary clique structure.

If α(G) ≤ √n, the complement G' has ω(G') ≥ n/α(G) ≥ √n.

This connects to off-diagonal Ramsey numbers.

title: Probabilistic Method
content:
**Alon's Proof Technique:**

1. Sample a random subset S of size ~√n
2. Compute expected induced edges E[e(S)]
3. Show E[e(S)] ≈ √n log n
4. Derandomize to get deterministic result

title: Contrapositive Form
content:
**Locally Sparse ⟹ Large Independence:**

If every set of ≤ √n vertices has o(√n log n) edges, then α(G) > √n.

Local sparsity implies the existence of large independent sets.

title: Summary
content:
**Erdős Problem #801: SOLVED (Alon, 1996)**

**Problem:** α(G) ≤ √n ⟹ ∃ small dense subset

**Answer:** YES - some ≤ √n vertices induce ≫ √n log n edges

**Key insight:** Bounded independence forces local density

**Applications:** Community detection, dense subgraph algorithms, Ramsey-type theorems
